      • setGridLines

        public int setGridLines()
        Description copied from interface: ArrayDataInterface
        Called at the beginning of the DisplayArray program
        Returns:
        0 = no grid lines, 1=1pixel wide, 2=2pixels wide. Anything else=1pixel

      • getArray

        public int[][] getArray()
        Description copied from interface: ArrayDataInterface
        Display Array calls this method repeatedly - everytime there is a mouse click. This method will return the updated array to DisplayArray for it to display.
        Returns:
        the array representing the board.

      • mouseXY

        public void mouseXY(int x,
                    int y,
                    boolean leftClick)
        Description copied from interface: ArrayDataInterface
        DisplayArray calls this whenever the mouse is clicked. to send the data back.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the mouse
        y - the y coordinate of the mouse
        leftClick - True if the left mouse button clicked. False if any other button clicked.

      • autoTimerInterval

        public int autoTimerInterval()
        Description copied from interface: ArrayDataInterface
        Called at the beginning of the DisplayArray program This enables a timer that will automatically call udpateData() and then update the screen. ERROR: If the value is too small, eg less than 250ms, two or three repaints are combined into one, so the display will miss updates. A zero or negative value means no timer. The timer interval must be more than 10ms. The timer will call updateData() every timerInterval and then it calls getArray() to display the updated data on the screen.
        Returns:
        the timer interval in milliseconds.

      • updateData

        public boolean updateData()
        Description copied from interface: ArrayDataInterface
        This method is called at the interval specified by autoTimerInterval(). After this, getArray() is called and then the updated data is displayed.
        Returns:
        False will stop the timer from continuing - e.g. at the end of the game. There is no way to restart it. MouseClicks still work though.
